intro: Chamaesaracha bolivensis, commonly known as the Bolivian chamaesaracha, is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Bolivia and neighboring regions. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Chamaesaracha bolivensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
